author: Staff Reporter
text:
Differently abled persons in the district are ready with a set of demands to be presented to all candidates in the eight Assembly segments when they come seeking votes.

T. Jayapal, district secretary of Tamil Nadu Association for the Rights of All Types of Differently Abled and Caregivers (TARATDAC), told The Hindu that a shelter home should be started by the government to rehabilitate all the mentally challenged persons presently living in the streets across the district.

The other demands include compulsory implementation of three per cent reservation in seats in all private schools and colleges for differently abled persons and preference for them when it comes to allocation of works under Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme.

“Monthly assistance for differently abled persons should be increased from Rs 1,000 to Rs 5,000”, said Mr. Jayapal.

A state level committee to monitor whether the welfare assistances meant for differently abled persons had reached the beneficiaries, should start the assessment immediately.
title: Differently abled persons prepare demands
